intro: Synadenium ballyi, commonly known as the Bally's milk bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, milky sap and unique inflorescence structure. The plant features palmate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions. Synadenium ballyi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
